subject: Self Care
title: The Attention Tax
description: Learn The Attention Tax in one minute.

hook.text: Every tab, app, and browser window takes a cognitive toll â€” even if you're not actively using it.

buildup.text: Open loops in your digital environment drain working memory. The brain tracks unfinished tasks in the background.

discovery.text: The Zeigarnik effect shows that incomplete tasks occupy mental bandwidth until they're closed or captured in a system.

twist.text: Closing 20 tabs doesn't just clean your screen. It frees cognitive resources you didn't know were being drained.

climax.text: At the end of each work session, close all tabs, clear notifications, and reset to a clean digital slate.

punchline.text: Every open tab costs mental energy. Close what you don't need.

quiz.question: How do open tabs and apps affect cognitive performance?
options: They drain working memory through the Zeigarnik effect on open loops
